title: Nedelišće
text:
Nedelišće (; <a href="Kajkavian%20language">Kajkavian</a>: "Nedelišče") is a <a href="village">village</a> in <a href="Me%C4%91imurje%20County">Međimurje County</a>, in northern <a href="Croatia">Croatia</a>, and the seat of the <a href="Municipalities%20of%20Croatia">Municipality</a> of Nedelišće, which also includes 10 other villages in the south-western part of Međimurje County.
Nedelišće itself is a <a href="suburb">suburb</a>an village located just outside the county seat, <a href="%C4%8Cakovec">Čakovec</a>, around 3 kilometres from the city's centre. Despite not being designated as either a city or a town, Nedelišće was the third most populated <a href="Settlement%20%28Croatia%29">settlement</a> in Međimurje County, after Čakovec and <a href="Prelog%2C%20Croatia">Prelog</a>, with 4,320 inhabitants according to the 2011 census.
History.
Nedelišće was first mentioned in 1226, in the Donation of the Hungarian King <a href="B%C3%A9la%20IV">Béla IV</a>. The settlement was named after Sunday (, local <a href="Kajkavian%20dialect">Kajkavian dialect</a>: "nedelja" or "nedela"), since the local people worship <a href="The%20Holy%20Trinity">The Holy Trinity</a> to which their <a href="Catholic%20Church">Catholic</a> parish is dedicated.
In the <a href="Middle%20Ages">Middle Ages</a>, the place has developed into a <a href="Market%20%28place%29">market</a> consisting of fairs and crafts. Between 1570 and 1586, Nedelišće was also the seat of one of the first Croatian <a href="printing">printing</a> offices. The first document about the establishment of a local school originates from 1660, when Međimurje was reigned by the <a href="Zrinski">Zrinski</a> family. The local <a href="volunteer%20fire%20department">volunteer fire department</a> was founded in 1908 and is the oldest in the municipality.
Geography.
The main road going through the municipality is the <a href="D3%20road%20%28Croatia%29">D3 state road</a>, connecting it with Čakovec to the east and <a href="Vara%C5%BEdin">Varaždin</a>. The <a href="D208%20road">D208 road</a> branches off of D3 road in Nedelišće and connects it with Trnovec border crossing with <a href="Slovenia">Slovenia</a> towards <a href="Ormo%C5%BE">Ormož</a>. There are also two railroads going through the municipality, one connecting Čakovec with the Slovenian town of Ormož to the west and the other one connecting the city with other Croatian cities such as <a href="Vara%C5%BEdin">Varaždin</a> and <a href="Zagreb">Zagreb</a> to the south.

Culture and sport.
Nedelišće is also known as the host of some manifestations, most notably the largest annual business fair in Međimurje County, MESAP (Croatian: "Međimurski sajam poduzetništva"), which usually takes place in June and gathers various companies from all over the county.
The local sports and <a href="gymnastics">gymnastics</a> centre, "SGC Aton", is considered the best-equipped gymnastics centre in the north-western Croatia. The local sports teams include the <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club <a href="Nk%20nedeli%C5%A1%C4%87e">NK Nedelišće</a>, who play in the <a href="Croatian%20Third%20League">Croatian Third League</a>, and the <a href="volleyball">volleyball</a> club OK Nedelišće, who play in the Second Croatian Volleyball League.
